sn2.10:4.2: Now at that time the Sun God had been seized by Rāhu, lord of demons.
sn2.10:4.3: Then the Sun God, recollecting the Buddha, at that time recited this verse:
sn2.10:6.1: Then the Buddha addressed Rāhu in verse concerning the Sun God:
sn2.10:7.1: “The Moon God has gone for refuge
sn2.10:7.2: to the Realized One, the perfected one.
sn2.10:7.4: Buddhas have compassion for the world!
sn2.10:8.1: He fills the darkness with light,
sn2.10:8.2: the shining sun, circle of magnificent flame.
sn2.10:8.3: Rāhu, do not swallow him as he traverses the sky.
sn2.10:8.4: Rāhu, release my progeny, the Sun!”
sn2.10:9.1: Then Rāhu, having released the Sun, rushed to see Vepacitti, lord of demons
sn2.10:9.2: and stood to one side, shocked and awestruck.
sn2.10:10.3: and came here looking like you’re in shock:
sn2.10:10.4: why do you stand there so scared?”
sn2.10:11.1: “My head would have exploded in seven pieces,
sn2.10:11.2: I would have found no happiness in life,
sn2.10:11.3: if, when enchanted by the Buddha’s spell,
sn2.10:11.4: I had not released the Sun.”
